name: List all labels for this repository
description:
**Note:** You can now use emoji in label names, add descriptions to labels, and search for labels in a repository. See the [blog post](/changes/2018-02-22-label-description-search-preview) for full details. To access these features and receive payloads with this data during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](/v3/media) in the `Accept` header:

    application/vnd.github.symmetra-preview+json
    

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

    GET /repos/:owner/:repo/labels
    

### [](#response)Response

    Status: 200 OK
    Link: <https://api.github.com/resource?page=2>; rel="next",
          <https://api.github.com/resource?page=5>; rel="last"
    

    [
      {
        "id": 208045946,
        "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/labels/bug",
        "name": "bug",
        "description": "Houston, we have a problem",
        "color": "f29513",
        "default": true
      }
    ]

name: Get a single label
description:
**Note:** You can now use emoji in label names, add descriptions to labels, and search for labels in a repository. See the [blog post](/changes/2018-02-22-label-description-search-preview) for full details. To access these features and receive payloads with this data during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](/v3/media) in the `Accept` header:

    application/vnd.github.symmetra-preview+json
    

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

    GET /repos/:owner/:repo/labels/:name
    

### [](#response-1)Response

    Status: 200 OK
    

    {
      "id": 208045946,
      "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/labels/bug",
      "name": "bug",
      "description": "Houston, we have a problem",
      "color": "f29513",
      "default": true
    }

name: Create a label
description:
**Note:** You can now use emoji in label names, add descriptions to labels, and search for labels in a repository. See the [blog post](/changes/2018-02-22-label-description-search-preview) for full details. To access these features and receive payloads with this data during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](/v3/media) in the `Accept` header:

    application/vnd.github.symmetra-preview+json
    

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

    POST /repos/:owner/:repo/labels
    

### [](#parameters)Parameters

Name

Type

Description

`name`

`string`

**Required**. The name of the label. Emoji can be added to label names, using either native emoji or colon-style markup. For example, typing `:strawberry:` will render the emoji ![:strawberry:](https://a248.e.akamai.net/assets.github.com/images/icons/emoji/unicode/1f353.png ":strawberry:"). For a full list of available emoji and codes, see [emoji-cheat-sheet.com](http://emoji-cheat-sheet.com/).

`color`

`string`

**Required**. The [hexadecimal color code](http://www.color-hex.com/) for the label, without the leading `#`.

`description`

`string`

A short description of the label.

### [](#example)Example

    {
      "name": "bug",
      "description": "Houston, we have a problem",
      "color": "f29513"
    }
    

### [](#response-2)Response

    Status: 201 Created
    Location: https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/labels/bug
    

    {
      "id": 208045946,
      "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/labels/bug",
      "name": "bug",
      "description": "Houston, we have a problem",
      "color": "f29513",
      "default": true
    }

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the label. Emoji can be added to label names, using either native emoji or colon-style markup. For example, typing `:strawberry:` will render the emoji ![:strawberry:](https://a248.e.akamai.net/assets.github.com/images/icons/emoji/unicode/1f353.png ":strawberry:"). For a full list of available emoji and codes, see [emoji-cheat-sheet.com](http://emoji-cheat-sheet.com/).

params.name: color
params.description: The [hexadecimal color code](http://www.color-hex.com/) for the label, without the leading `#`.

params.name: description
params.description: A short description of the label.

name: Update a label
description:
**Note:** You can now use emoji in label names, add descriptions to labels, and search for labels in a repository. See the [blog post](/changes/2018-02-22-label-description-search-preview) for full details. To access these features and receive payloads with this data during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](/v3/media) in the `Accept` header:

    application/vnd.github.symmetra-preview+json
    

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

    PATCH /repos/:owner/:repo/labels/:name
    

### [](#parameters-1)Parameters

Name

Type

Description

`name`

`string`

The name of the label. Emoji can be added to label names, using either native emoji or colon-style markup. For example, typing `:strawberry:` will render the emoji ![:strawberry:](https://a248.e.akamai.net/assets.github.com/images/icons/emoji/unicode/1f353.png ":strawberry:"). For a full list of available emoji and codes, see [emoji-cheat-sheet.com](http://emoji-cheat-sheet.com/).

`color`

`string`

The [hexadecimal color code](http://www.color-hex.com/) for the label, without the leading `#`.

`description`

`string`

A short description of the label.

### [](#example-1)Example

    {
      "name": "bug :bug:",
      "description": "Small bug fix required",
      "color": "b01f26"
    }
    

### [](#response-3)Response

    Status: 200 OK
    

    {
      "id": 208045946,
      "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/labels/bug%20:bug:",
      "name": "bug :bug:",
      "description": "Small bug fix required",
      "color": "b01f26",
      "default": true
    }

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the label. Emoji can be added to label names, using either native emoji or colon-style markup. For example, typing `:strawberry:` will render the emoji ![:strawberry:](https://a248.e.akamai.net/assets.github.com/images/icons/emoji/unicode/1f353.png ":strawberry:"). For a full list of available emoji and codes, see [emoji-cheat-sheet.com](http://emoji-cheat-sheet.com/).

params.name: color
params.description: The [hexadecimal color code](http://www.color-hex.com/) for the label, without the leading `#`.

params.name: description
params.description: A short description of the label.

name: List labels on an issue
description:
**Note:** You can now use emoji in label names, add descriptions to labels, and search for labels in a repository. See the [blog post](/changes/2018-02-22-label-description-search-preview) for full details. To access these features and receive payloads with this data during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](/v3/media) in the `Accept` header:

    application/vnd.github.symmetra-preview+json
    

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

    GET /repos/:owner/:repo/issues/:number/labels
    

### [](#response-5)Response

    Status: 200 OK
    Link: <https://api.github.com/resource?page=2>; rel="next",
          <https://api.github.com/resource?page=5>; rel="last"
    

    [
      {
        "id": 208045946,
        "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/labels/bug",
        "name": "bug",
        "description": "Houston, we have a problem",
        "color": "f29513",
        "default": true
      }
    ]

**Note:** You can now use emoji in label names, add descriptions to labels, and search for labels in a repository. See the [blog post](/changes/2018-02-22-label-description-search-preview) for full details. To access these features and receive payloads with this data during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](/v3/media) in the `Accept` header:

    application/vnd.github.symmetra-preview+json
    

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

    POST /repos/:owner/:repo/issues/:number/labels
    

### [](#input)Input

    [
      "Label1",
      "Label2"
    ]
    

### [](#response-6)Response

    Status: 200 OK
    

    [
      {

        "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/labels/bug",
        "name": "bug",
        "description": "Houston, we have a problem",

name: Remove a label from an issue
description:
**Note:** You can now use emoji in label names, add descriptions to labels, and search for labels in a repository. See the [blog post](/changes/2018-02-22-label-description-search-preview) for full details. To access these features and receive payloads with this data during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](/v3/media) in the `Accept` header:

    application/vnd.github.symmetra-preview+json
    

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

    DELETE /repos/:owner/:repo/issues/:number/labels/:name
    

### [](#response-if-the-label-was-removed-successfully)Response if the label was removed successfully

    Status: 200 OK
    

    [
      {
        "id": 208045946,
        "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/labels/bug",
        "name": "bug",
        "description": "Houston, we have a problem",
        "color": "f29513",
        "default": true
      }
    ]
    

### [](#response-if-the-label-does-not-exist)Response if the label does not exist

    Status: 404 Not Found
    

    {
      "message": "Label does not exist",
      "documentation_url": "https://developer.github.com/v3"
    }

name: Replace all labels for an issue
description:
**Note:** You can now use emoji in label names, add descriptions to labels, and search for labels in a repository. See the [blog post](/changes/2018-02-22-label-description-search-preview) for full details. To access these features and receive payloads with this data during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](/v3/media) in the `Accept` header:

    application/vnd.github.symmetra-preview+json
    

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

    PUT /repos/:owner/:repo/issues/:number/labels
    

### [](#input-1)Input

    [
      "Label1",
      "Label2"
    ]
    

Sending an empty array (`[]`) will remove all Labels from the Issue.

### [](#response-7)Response

    Status: 200 OK
    

    [
      {
        "id": 208045946,
        "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/octocat/Hello-World/labels/bug",
        "name": "bug",
        "description": "Houston, we have a problem",
        "color": "f29513",
        "default": true
      }
    ]

name: Remove all labels from an issue

See the [blog post](/changes/2018-02-22-label-description-search-preview) for full details. To access these features and receive payloads with this data during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](/v3/media) in the `Accept` header:
